          Object Requirements:
          • for username, at least one of the following must be true:
            • username must be equal to 'vagrant'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8655503 (shadow_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', chg_req must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8655503 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:true
          Title:no null max pw ages.
          Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8655502 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/shadow'
          • for pattern, at least one of the following must be true:
            • pattern must match the pattern '^vagrant:[^:]*:[^:]*:[^:]*::'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8655502 (password_test)
          Result:true
          Title:interactive users exist.
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8655501 (password_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • username must match the pattern '.*'
          Include Items If:
          • user_id is greater than or equal to '1000'
          Include Items If:
          • for check = 'all', user_id, all of the following must be true:
            • user_id does not equal '65534'
            • user_id does not equal '65535'
            • user_id does not equal '4294967294'
            • user_id does not equal '4294967295'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • username equals 'vagrant'
          • password equals [MASKED PASSWORD FIELD]
          • user_id equals '1000'
          • group_id equals '1000'
          • gcos equals ''
          • home_dir equals '/home/vagrant'
          • login_shell equals '/bin/bash'
          • last_login equals '0'

          V-204422 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that passwords are prohibited from reuse for a minimum of five generations.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204422r880836_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-010270
          Identities:V-71933
          SV-86557
          CCI-000200 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (e); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (e))
          Description: Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks. If the information system or application allows the user to consecutively reuse their password when that password has exceeded its defined lifetime, the end result is a password that is not changed per policy requirements. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to prohibit password reuse for a minimum of five generations.

          Add the following line in "/etc/pam.d/system-auth" and "/etc/pam.d/password-auth" (or modify the line to have the required value):

          password requisite pam_pwhistory.so use_authtok remember=5 retry=3

          Note: Per requirement RHEL-07-010199, RHEL 7 must be configured to not overwrite custom authentication configuration settings while using the authconfig utility, otherwise manual changes to the listed files will be overwritten whenever the authconfig utility is used.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Identifier:2899
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:486
          Result:false
          Title:Limit Password Reuse
          Description:The passwords to remember should be set correctly.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (Test if remember attribute of pam_pwhistory.so is set correctly in /etc/pam.d/system-auth)
            • false (Test if remember attribute of pam_pwhistory.so is set correctly in /etc/pam.d/password-auth)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:488 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Test if remember attribute of pam_pwhistory.so is set correctly in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2376 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*password\s+(?:(?:requisite)|(?:required))\s+pam_pwhistory\.so[^#\n\r]*remember=([0-9]*).*$'
          • instance must be equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2375 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • for check = 'all', subexpression, the following must be true:
            • subexpression must be greater than or equal to '5'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:48800 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:Test if remember attribute of pam_pwhistory.so is set correctly in /etc/pam.d/password-auth
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:237600 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam.d/password-auth'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*password\s+(?:(?:requisite)|(?:required))\s+pam_pwhistory\.so[^#\n\r]*remember=([0-9]*).*$'
          • instance must be equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2375 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • for check = 'all', subexpression, the following must be true:
            • subexpression must be greater than or equal to '5'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-204423 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that passwords are a minimum of 15 characters in length.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204423r603261_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-010280
          Identities:V-71935
          SV-86559
          CCI-000205 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (i); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
          Description: The shorter the password, the lower the number of possible combinations that need to be tested before the password is compromised.

          Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks. Password length is one factor of several that helps to determine strength and how long it takes to crack a password. Use of more characters in a password helps to exponentially increase the time and/or resources required to compromise the password. false
          Fix Text:Configure operating system to enforce a minimum 15-character password length.

          Add the following line to "/etc/security/pwquality.conf" (or modify the line to have the required value):

          minlen = 15
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Identifier:2899
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:476
          Result:false
          Title:Set Password minlen Requirements
          Description:The password minlen should meet minimum requirements
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (check the configuration of /etc/security/pwquality.conf)
            • true (All child checks must be true.)
              • true (check the configuration of /etc/pam.d/system-auth)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:477 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:check the configuration of /etc/security/pwquality.conf
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2364 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/security/pwquality.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^minlen[\s]*=[\s]*(-?\d+)(?:[\s]|$)'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2365 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', instance must be equal to '1'
          • for check = 'all', subexpression, the following must be true:
            • subexpression must be greater than or equal to '15'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:480 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:true
          Title:check the configuration of /etc/pam.d/system-auth
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2368 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*password\s+(?:(?:required)|(?:requisite))\s+pam_pwquality\.so.*$'
          • instance must be equal to '1'

          • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
          • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
          • filename equals 'system-auth'
          • pattern equals '^\s*password\s+(?:(?:required)|(?:requisite))\s+pam_pwquality\.so.*$'
          • instance equals '1'
          • text equals '
            password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type='
          • line equals '
            password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type='
          • subexpression does not exist

          V-204426 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must disable account identifiers (individuals, groups, roles, and devices) if the password expires.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204426r809190_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-010310
          Identities:SV-86565
          V-71941
          CCI-000795 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-4 e; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-4.1 (iii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-4 e)
          Description: Inactive identifiers pose a risk to systems and applications because attackers may exploit an inactive identifier and potentially obtain undetected access to the system. Owners of inactive accounts will not notice if unauthorized access to their user account has been obtained.

          Operating systems need to track periods of inactivity and disable application identifiers after 35 days of inactivity. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable account identifiers (individuals, groups, roles, and devices) 35 days after the password expires.

          Add the following line to "/etc/default/useradd" (or modify the line to have the required value):

          INACTIVE=35
          DoD recommendation is 35 days, but a lower value is acceptable. The value "-1" will disable this feature, and "0" will disable the account immediately after the password expires.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Identifier:2899
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:443
          Result:false
          Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must disable account identifiers (individuals, groups, roles, and devices) if the password expires.
          Description:Inactive identifiers pose a risk to systems and applications because attackers may exploit an inactive identifier and potentially obtain undetected access to the system. Owners of inactive accounts will not notice if unauthorized access to their user account has been obtained.

          Operating systems need to track periods of inactivity and disable application identifiers after zero35 days of inactivity.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (the value INACTIVE parameter should be set appropriately in /etc/default/useradd)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:444 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:the value INACTIVE parameter should be set appropriately in /etc/default/useradd
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          State Operator:All item-state comparisons must be true.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2333 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/default/useradd'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*INACTIVE\s*=\s*(\d+)\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2334 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be less than or equal to '35'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2335 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be greater than or equal to '0'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-204429 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that users must provide a password for privilege escalation.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204429r861003_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-010340
          Identities:V-71947
          SV-86571
          CCI-002038 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-11)
          Description: Without re-authentication, users may access resources or perform tasks for which they do not have authorization.

          When operating systems provide the capability to escalate a functional capability, it is critical the user re-authenticate.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00156, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00157, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00158 false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to require users to supply a password for privilege escalation.

          Check the configuration of the "/etc/sudoers" file with the following command:
          $ sudo visudo

          Remove any occurrences of "NOPASSWD" tags in the file.

          Check the configuration of the /etc/sudoers.d/* files with the following command:
          $ sudo grep -ir nopasswd /etc/sudoers.d

          Remove any occurrences of "NOPASSWD" tags in the file.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Identifier:2899

          Description:Checks sudo usage without password
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (NOPASSWD does not exist /etc/sudoers)
            • false (NOPASSWD does not exist in /etc/sudoers.d)
          Tests:

          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2108 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sudoers'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^(?!#).*[\s]+NOPASSWD[\s]*\:.*$'
          • instance must be equal to '1'
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:178 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:NOPASSWD does not exist in /etc/sudoers.d
          Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2109 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/sudoers.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '^.*$'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^(?!#).*[\s]+NOPASSWD[\s]*\:.*$'
          • instance must be equal to '1'
          Collected Item/State Result:

          • filepath equals '/etc/sudoers.d/vagrant'
          • path equals '/etc/sudoers.d'

          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-204431 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the delay between logon prompts following a failed console logon attempt is at least four seconds.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204431r603261_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-010430
          Identities:SV-86575
          V-71951
          CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: Configuring the operating system to implement organization-wide security implementation guides and security checklists verifies compliance with federal standards and establishes a common security baseline across DoD that reflects the most restrictive security posture consistent with operational requirements.

          Configuration settings are the set of parameters that can be changed in hardware, software, or firmware components of the system that affect the security posture and/or functionality of the system. Security-related parameters are those parameters impacting the security state of the system, including the parameters required to satisfy other security control requirements. Security-related parameters include, for example, registry settings; account, file, and directory permission settings; and settings for functions, ports, protocols, services, and remote connections. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to enforce a delay of at least four seconds between logon prompts following a failed console logon attempt.

          Modify the "/etc/login.defs" file to set the "FAIL_DELAY" parameter to "4" or greater:

          FAIL_DELAY 4
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Identifier:2899

          Result:false
          Title:Ensure that FAIL_DELAY is Configured in /etc/login.defs
          Description:The delay between failed authentication attempts should be
          set for all users specified in /etc/login.defs
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (check FAIL_DELAY in /etc/login.defs)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:102 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:check FAIL_DELAY in /etc/login.defs
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2055 (textfilecontent54_object)

          • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*FAIL_DELAY[\s]+([^#\s]*)'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

          V-204434 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow users to override SSH environment variables.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204434r877377_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-010460
          Identities:SV-86581
          V-71957
          CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: Failure to restrict system access to authenticated users negatively impacts operating system security. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to not allow users to override environment variables to the SSH daemon.

          Edit the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file to uncomment or add the line for "PermitUserEnvironment" keyword and set the value to "no":

          PermitUserEnvironment no

          The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Identifier:2899
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1385
          Result:false
          Title:Do Not Allow Users to Set Environment Options
          Description:PermitUserEnvironment should be disabled
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (Check value of PermitUserEnvironment in /etc/ssh/sshd_config)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (package openssh-server is removed)
          Tests:

          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)PermitUserEnvironment(?-i)[\s]+(\w*)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:138600 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal (case insensitive) to 'no'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
          Result:false
          Title:package openssh-server is removed
          Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • name equals 'openssh-server'
          • arch equals 'x86_64'
          • epoch equals '(none)'

          V-204435 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow a non-certificate trusted host SSH logon to the system.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204435r877377_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-010470
          Identities:SV-86583
          V-71959
          CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          Description: Failure to restrict system access to authenticated users negatively impacts operating system security. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to not allow a non-certificate trusted host SSH logon to the system.

          Edit the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file to uncomment or add the line for "HostbasedAuthentication" keyword and set the value to "no":

          V-204445 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that a file integrity tool verifies the baseline operating system configuration at least weekly.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204445r902698_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-020030
          Identities:SV-86597
          V-71973
          CCI-001744 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-3 (5); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-3 (5))
          Description: Unauthorized changes to the baseline configuration could make the system vulnerable to various attacks or allow unauthorized access to the operating system. Changes to operating system configurations can have unintended side effects, some of which may be relevant to security.

          Detecting such changes and providing an automated response can help avoid unintended, negative consequences that could ultimately affect the security state of the operating system. The operating system's Information System Security Manager (ISSM)/Information System Security Officer (ISSO) and System Administrators (SAs) must be notified via email and/or monitoring system trap when there is an unauthorized modification of a configuration item. false
          Fix Text:Configure the file integrity tool to run automatically on the system at least weekly.

          The following example output is generic. It will set cron to run AIDE daily, but other file integrity tools may be used:

          # more /etc/cron.daily/aide
          #!/bin/bash

          /usr/sbin/aide --check | /bin/mail -s "$HOSTNAME - Daily AIDE integrity check run" root@example_server_name.mil

          Note: Per requirement RHEL-07-020028, the "mailx" package must be installed on the system to enable email functionality.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Identifier:2899
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7os:def:204445
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-07-020030 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that a file integrity tool verifies the baseline operating system configuration at least weekly.
          Description:Unauthorized changes to the baseline configuration could make the system vulnerable to various attacks or allow unauthorized access to the operating system. Changes to operating system configurations can have unintended side effects, some of which may be relevant to security.

          Detecting such changes and providing an automated response can help avoid unintended, negative consequences that could ultimately affect the security state of the operating system. The operating system's Information System Security Manager (ISSM)/Information System Security Officer (ISSO) and System Administrators (SAs) must be notified via email and/or monitoring system trap when there is an unauthorized modification of a configuration item.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                • false (AIDE is configured to run daily with /etc/crontab)
                • false (AIDE is configured to run daily with /etc/cron.d)
                • false (AIDE is configured to run daily with /var/spool/cron/root)
                • false (AIDE is configured to run daily with cron.daily)
                • false (AIDE is configured to run daily with cron.weekly)
                • false (AIDE is configured to run daily with cron.hourly)
              • false (AIDE package is installed)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:tst:20444501 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:AIDE is configured to run daily with /etc/crontab
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:obj:20444501 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/crontab'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*([\S]+[ \t]+[\S]+[ \t]+\*[ \t]+\*[ \t]+[\S]+)[ \t]+root[ \t]+\/usr\/sbin\/aide[ \t]+\-\-check(?:[\s]+|[\>\|]|$)'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:ste:20444500 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '((?:[0-5]?[0-9]|\*)[ \t]+(?:[01]?[0-9]|2[0-3]|\*)[ \t]+\*[ \t]+\*[ \t]+(?:[0-7]|sun|mon|tue|wed|thu|fri|sat))'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:ste:20444501 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '((?:[0-5]?[0-9]|\*)[ \t]+(?:[01]?[0-9]|2[0-3])[ \t]+\*[ \t]+\*[ \t]+(?:[0-7]|sun|mon|tue|wed|thu|fri|sat|\*))'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:ste:20444502 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '((?:[0-5]?[0-9])[ \t]+(?:[01]?[0-9]|2[0-3]|\*)[ \t]+\*[ \t]+\*[ \t]+(?:[0-7]|sun|mon|tue|wed|thu|fri|sat|\*))'

          V-204449 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured to disable USB mass storage.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204449r853891_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-020100
          Identities:SV-86607
          V-71983
          CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
          CCI-000778 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-3; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-3.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-3)
          CCI-001958 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-3)
          Description: USB mass storage permits easy introduction of unknown devices, thereby facilitating malicious activity.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000114-GPOS-00059, SRG-OS-000378-GPOS-00163, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227 false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable the ability to use the USB Storage kernel module.

          Create a file under "/etc/modprobe.d" with the following command:

          # touch /etc/modprobe.d/usb-storage.conf

          Add the following line to the created file:

          install usb-storage /bin/true

          Configure the operating system to disable the ability to use USB mass storage devices.

          # vi /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf

          Add or update the line:

          blacklist usb-storage
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Identifier:2899
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1141
          Result:false
          Title:Disable usb-storage Kernel Module
          Description:The kernel module usb-storage should be disabled.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (kernel module usb-storage disabled)
            • false (kernel module usb-storage blacklisted in /etc/modprobe.d)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1142 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:kernel module usb-storage disabled
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2892 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*install\s+usb-storage\s+(\S+)\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8660700 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '/bin/true'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8660700 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:kernel module usb-storage blacklisted in /etc/modprobe.d
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8660700 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*blacklist\s+usb-storage\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-204450 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the Datagram Congestion Control Protocol (DCCP) kernel module is disabled unless required.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204450r853892_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-020101
          Identities:V-77821
          SV-92517
          CCI-001958 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-3)
          Description: Disabling DCCP protects the system against exploitation of any flaws in the protocol implementation. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable the ability to use the DCCP kernel module.

          Create a file under "/etc/modprobe.d" with the following command:

          # touch /etc/modprobe.d/dccp.conf

          Add the following line to the created file:

          install dccp /bin/true

          Ensure that the DCCP module is blacklisted:

          # vi /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf

          Add or update the line:

          blacklist dccp
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Identifier:2899

          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (kernel module dccp disabled)
            • true (kernel module dccp blacklisted in /etc/modprobe.d)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9251700 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:kernel module dccp disabled
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9251700 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*install\s+dccp\s+(\S+)\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9251700 (textfilecontent54_state)

          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '/bin/true'

          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9251701 (textfilecontent54_object)

          • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*blacklist\s+dccp\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

          • filepath equals '/etc/modprobe.d/dccp-blacklist.conf'

          V-204504 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must shut down upon audit processing failure, unless availability is an overriding concern. If availability is a concern, the system must alert the designated staff (System Administrator [SA] and Information System Security Officer [ISSO] at a minimum) in the event of an audit processing failure.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204504r880761_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-030010
          Identities:V-72081
          SV-86705
          CCI-000139 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-5 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-5.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-5 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-5 a)
          Description: It is critical for the appropriate personnel to be aware if a system is at risk of failing to process audit logs as required. Without this notification, the security personnel may be unaware of an impending failure of the audit capability, and system operation may be adversely affected.

          Audit processing failures include software/hardware errors, failures in the audit capturing mechanisms, and audit storage capacity being reached or exceeded.

          This requirement applies to each audit data storage repository (i.e., distinct information system component where audit records are stored), the centralized audit storage capacity of organizations (i.e., all audit data storage repositories combined), or both.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000046-GPOS-00022, SRG-OS-000047-GPOS-00023 false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to shut down in the event of an audit processing failure.

          Add or correct the option to shut down the operating system with the following command:

          # auditctl -f 2

          Edit the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file and add the following line:

          -f 2

          If availability has been determined to be more important, and this decision is documented with the ISSO, configure the operating system to notify system administration staff and ISSO staff in the event of an audit processing failure with the following command:

          # auditctl -f 1

          Edit the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file and add the following line:

          -f 1

          Kernel log monitoring must also be configured to properly alert designated staff.

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Identifier:2899
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:776
          Result:false
          Title:Shutdown System When Auditing Failures Occur
          Description:The system will shutdown when auditing fails.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit augenrules configuration shutdown)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (audit augenrules)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (audit auditctl configuration shutdown)
              • false (All child checks must be true.)
                • false (audit auditctl)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:777 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:audit augenrules configuration shutdown
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2600 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*\-f\s*2\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:true
          Title:audit augenrules
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ not evaluated ]
          • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
          • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
          • filename equals 'auditd.service'
          • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
          • instance equals '1'
          • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
          • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
          • subexpression does not exist
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:778 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:audit auditctl configuration shutdown
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2601 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*\-f\s*2\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false

          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

          • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-204506 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured to off-load audit logs onto a different system or storage media from the system being audited.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204506r877390_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-030201
          Identities:SV-95729
          V-81017
          CCI-001851 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-4 (1))
          Description: Information stored in one location is vulnerable to accidental or incidental deletion or alteration.

          Off-loading is a common process in information systems with limited audit storage capacity.

          One method of off-loading audit logs in Red Hat Enterprise Linux is with the use of the audisp-remote dameon. Without the configuration of the "au-remote" plugin, the audisp-remote daemon will not off load the logs from the system being audited.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000342-GPOS-00133, SRG-OS-000479-GPOS-00224 false
          Fix Text:Edit the /etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf file and add or update the following values:

          active = yes
          direction = out
          path = /sbin/audisp-remote
          type = always

          The audit daemon must be restarted for changes to take effect:

          # service auditd restart
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Identifier:2899
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:95729
          Result:false
          Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must configure the au-remote plugin to off-load audit logs using the audisp-remote daemon.
          Description:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must configure the au-remote plugin to off-load audit logs using the audisp-remote daemon.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf active = yes)
            • false (/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf direction = out)
            • false (/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf path = /sbin/audisp-remote)
            • false (/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf type = always)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9572700 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf active = yes
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9572700 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • behavior requirements:
            • ignore_case = true
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ ]*active[ ]+=[ ]+([^ ]*)[ ]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9572700 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^[Yy][Ee][Ss]$'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9572900 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf direction = out
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9572900 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • behavior requirements:
            • ignore_case = true
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ ]*direction[ ]+=[ ]+([^ ]*)[ ]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9572900 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^[Oo][Uu][Tt]$'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9572901 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf path = /sbin/audisp-remote
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9572901 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • behavior requirements:
            • ignore_case = true
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ ]*path[ ]+=[ ]+([^ ]*)[ ]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9572901 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^\/sbin\/audisp\-remote$'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9572902 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf type = always
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9572902 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • behavior requirements:
            • ignore_case = true
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ ]*type[ ]+=[ ]+([^ ]*)[ ]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9572902 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^[Aa][Ll][Ww][Aa][Yy][Ss]$'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-204509 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must off-load audit records onto a different system or media from the system being audited.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204509r877390_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-030300
          Identities:V-72083
          SV-86707
          CCI-001851 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-4 (1))
          Description: Information stored in one location is vulnerable to accidental or incidental deletion or alteration.

          Off-loading is a common process in information systems with limited audit storage capacity.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000342-GPOS-00133, SRG-OS-000479-GPOS-00224 false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to off-load audit records onto a different system or media from the system being audited.

          Set the remote server option in "/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf" with the IP address of the log aggregation server.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Identifier:2899
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:86707
          Result:false
          Title:The operating system must off-load audit records onto a different system or media from the system being audited.
          Description:The operating system must off-load audit records onto a different system or media from the system being audited.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf remote_system is not empty)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8670700 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf remote_system is not empty
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8670700 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • behavior requirements:
            • ignore_case = true
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ ]*remote_server[ ]+=[ ]+(.*)'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8670700 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^.+$'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-204510 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must encrypt the transfer of audit records off-loaded onto a different system or media from the system being audited.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204510r877390_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-030310
          Identities:V-72085
          SV-86709
          CCI-001851 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-4 (1))
          Description: Information stored in one location is vulnerable to accidental or incidental deletion or alteration.

          Off-loading is a common process in information systems with limited audit storage capacity.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000342-GPOS-00133, SRG-OS-000479-GPOS-00224 false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to encrypt the transfer of off-loaded audit records onto a different system or media from the system being audited.

          Uncomment the "enable_krb5" option in "/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf" and set it with the following line:

          V-204511 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the audit system takes appropriate action when the audit storage volume is full.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204511r877390_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-030320
          Identities:V-72087
          SV-86711
          CCI-001851 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-4 (1))
          Description: Taking appropriate action in case of a filled audit storage volume will minimize the possibility of losing audit records.
          One method of off-loading audit logs in Red Hat Enterprise Linux is with the use of the audisp-remote dameon. false
          Fix Text:Configure the action the operating system takes if the disk the audit records are written to becomes full.

          Uncomment or edit the "disk_full_action" option in "/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf" and set it to "syslog", "single", or "halt", such as the following line:

          disk_full_action = single
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Identifier:2899
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:86711
          Result:false
          Title:The audit system must take appropriate action when the audit storage volume is full.
          Description:The audit system must take appropriate action when the audit storage volume is full.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf disk_full_action = syslog, single, or halt)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8671100 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf disk_full_action = syslog, single, or halt
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8671100 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • behavior requirements:
            • ignore_case = true
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*disk_full_action\s+=\s+(\S+)\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8671100 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^[Ss][Yy][Ss][Ll][Oo][Gg]$'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8671101 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^[Ss][Ii][Nn][Gg][Ll][Ee]$'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8671102 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^[Hh][Aa][Ll][Tt]$'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-204512 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the audit system takes appropriate action when there is an error sending audit records to a remote system.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204512r877390_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-030321
          Identities:V-73163
          SV-87815
          CCI-001851 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-4 (1))
          Description: Taking appropriate action when there is an error sending audit records to a remote system will minimize the possibility of losing audit records.
          One method of off-loading audit logs in Red Hat Enterprise Linux is with the use of the audisp-remote dameon. false
          Fix Text:Configure the action the operating system takes if there is an error sending audit records to a remote system.

          Uncomment the "network_failure_action" option in "/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf" and set it to "syslog", "single", or "halt".

          network_failure_action = syslog
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:

          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target

          Class:compliance

          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8781500 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false

          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8781500 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '(?i)^\s*network_failure_action[ ]*=[ ]*([\w]+)\s*'
          • instance must be equal to '1'

          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?i)^syslog|single|halt$'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-204514 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must immediately notify the System Administrator (SA) and Information System Security Officer (ISSO) (at a minimum) via email when the threshold for the repository maximum audit record storage capacity is reached.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204514r877389_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-030340
          Identities:V-72091
          SV-86715
          CCI-001855 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-5 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-5 (1))
          Description: If security personnel are not notified immediately when the threshold for the repository maximum audit record storage capacity is reached, they are unable to expand the audit record storage capacity before records are lost. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to immediately notify the SA and ISSO (at a minimum) when the threshold for the repository maximum audit record storage capacity is reached.

          Uncomment or edit the "space_left_action" keyword in "/etc/audit/auditd.conf" and set it to "email".

          space_left_action = email
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Identifier:2899

          Result:false
          Title:The operating system must immediately notify the System Administrator (SA) and Information System Security Officer (ISSO) (at a minimum) via email when the threshold for the repository maximum audit record storage capacity is reached.
          Description:The operating system must immediately notify the System Administrator (SA) and Information System Security Officer (ISSO) (at a minimum) via email when the threshold for the repository maximum audit record storage capacity is reached.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (/etc/audit/auditd.conf space_left_action = email)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8671500 (textfilecontent54_test)

          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8671500 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • behavior requirements:
            • ignore_case = true
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[ ]*space_left_action[ ]+=[ ]+([^ ]*)[ ]*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8671500 (textfilecontent54_state)
          State Requirements:
          • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^[Ee][Mm][Aa][Ii][Ll]$'
          Collected Item/State Result:
          [ false ]

          • path equals '/etc/audit'

          V-204516 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all executions of privileged functions.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204516r853914_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-030360
          Identities:V-72095
          SV-86719
          CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
          Description: Misuse of privileged functions, either intentionally or unintentionally by authorized users, or by unauthorized external entities that have compromised information system accounts, is a serious and ongoing concern and can have significant adverse impacts on organizations. Auditing the use of privileged functions is one way to detect such misuse and identify the risk from insider threats and the advanced persistent threat. false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to audit the execution of privileged functions.

          Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

          -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S execve -C uid!=euid -F euid=0 -k setuid
          -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S execve -C uid!=euid -F euid=0 -k setuid
          -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S execve -C gid!=egid -F egid=0 -k setgid
          -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S execve -C gid!=egid -F egid=0 -k setgid

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Identifier:2899
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:710
          Result:false
          Title:The Red Hat EnterpriseLinux Operating system must audit all executions of privileged functions.
          Description:Misuse of privileged functions, either intentionally or unintentionally by authorized users, or by unauthorized external entities that have compromised information system accounts, is a serious and ongoing concern and can have a significant adverse impacts on orginizations.
          Auditing the use of privileged functions is one way to detect such misuse and identify the risk from insider threats and the advanced persistent threat.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (audit augenrules execve uid 64-bit)
                  • false (audit augenrules execve gid 64-bit)
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
                  • true (All child checks must be true.)
                    • true (64 bit architecture)
                  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                    • false (64 bit architecture)
                    • false (64 bit architecture)
              • false (audit augenrules execve uid 32-bit)
              • false (audit augenrules execve gid 32-bit)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (audit augenrules)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (audit auditctl execve uid 64-bit)
                  • false (audit auditctl execve gid 64-bit)
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
                  • true (All child checks must be true.)
                    • true (64 bit architecture)
                  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                    • false (64 bit architecture)
                    • false (64 bit architecture)
              • false (audit auditctl execve uid 32-bit)
              • false (audit auditctl execve gid 32-bit)
              • false (All child checks must be true.)
                • false (audit auditctl)
          Tests:
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8671900 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:audit augenrules execve uid 64-bit
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8671900 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
          • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\-a\s+always,exit\s+\-F\s+arch=b64\s+\-S\s+execve\s+\-C\s+uid!=euid\s+\-F\s+euid=0\s+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8671901 (textfilecontent54_test)

          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.

          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8671901 (textfilecontent54_object)

          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

          • pattern must match the pattern '^\-a\s+always,exit\s+\-F\s+arch=b64\s+\-S\s+execve\s+\-C\s+uid!=euid\s+\-F\s+euid=0\s+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8671903 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:audit auditctl execve gid 64-bit
          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8671903 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^\-a\s+always,exit\s+\-F\s+arch=b64\s+\-S\s+execve\s+\-C\s+gid!=egid\s+\-F\s+egid=0\s+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:713 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false

          Check Existence:All collected items must exist.

          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

          • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-204517 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chown, fchown, fchownat, and lchown syscalls.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204517r809570_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-030370
          Identities:SV-86721
          V-72097
          CCI-000126 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-2.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-2 c)
          CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

          When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

          The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall made by all programs on the system. Therefore, it is very important to use syscall rules only when absolutely necessary since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. The performance can be helped, however, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000474-GPOS-00219 false
          Fix Text:Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

          -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S chown,fchown,fchownat,lchown -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k perm_mod

          -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S chown,fchown,fchownat,lchown -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k perm_mod

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Identifier:2899
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:552
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-07-030370 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chown, fchown, fchownat and lchown syscalls.
          Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

          When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.
          The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall that all programs on the system makes. Therefore, it is very important to only use syscall rules when you have to since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. You can help the performance, though, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)

                • false (audit augenrules 64-bit fchownat)
                • false (audit augenrules 64-bit lchown)
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
                  • true (All child checks must be true.)
                    • true (64 bit architecture)
                  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                    • false (64 bit architecture)
                    • false (64 bit architecture)
              • false (audit augenrules 32-bit chown)
              • false (audit augenrules 32-bit fchown)
              • false (audit augenrules 32-bit fchownat)
              • false (audit augenrules 32-bit lchown)
              • true (All child checks must be true.)
                • true (audit augenrules)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                • false (audit auditctl 64-bit chown)
                • false (audit auditctl 64-bit fchown)
                • false (audit auditctl 64-bit fchownat)
                • false (audit auditctl 64-bit lchown)
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
                  • true (All child checks must be true.)
                    • true (64 bit architecture)
                  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                    • false (64 bit architecture)
                    • false (64 bit architecture)
              • false (audit auditctl 32-bit chown)
              • false (audit auditctl 32-bit fchown)
              • false (audit auditctl 32-bit fchownat)
              • false (audit auditctl 32-bit lchown)
              • false (All child checks must be true.)
                • false (audit auditctl)

          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b32[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+fchown[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])fchown([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|unset|-1)[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+[\s]*$'
          • instance must be equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:575 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:audit auditctl 32-bit fchownat
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2450 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b32[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+fchownat[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])fchownat([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+[\s]*$'
          • instance must be equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
          Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:590 (textfilecontent54_test)
          Result:false
          Title:audit auditctl 32-bit lchown
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

          Title:audit auditctl
          Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
          Check:Result is based on check existence only.
          Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
          Object Requirements:
          • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
          • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
          • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
          Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

          V-204521 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chmod, fchmod, and fchmodat syscalls.

          Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204521r809772_rule
          Test Type:Automated
          Result:Fail
          Version:RHEL-07-030410
          Identities:SV-86729
          V-72105
          CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
          Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

          When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

          The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall made by all programs on the system. Therefore, it is very important to use syscall rules only when absolutely necessary since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. The performance can be helped, however, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.

          Satisfies: SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033 false
          Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records upon successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "chmod", "fchmod", and "fchmodat" syscalls.

          Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

          -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S chmod,fchmod,fchmodat -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k perm_mod

          -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S chmod,fchmod,fchmodat -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k perm_mod

          The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
          Severity:medium
          Weight:10.0
          Reference:
          Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Publisher:DISA
          Type:DPMS Target
          Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
          Identifier:2899
          Definitions:
          Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:546
          Result:false
          Title:RHEL-07-030410 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chmod, fchmod and fchmodat syscalls.
          Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

          Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

          When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.
          The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall that all programs on the system makes. Therefore, it is very important to only use syscall rules when you have to since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. You can help the performance, though, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.
          Class:compliance
          Tests:

                  • true (All child checks must be true.)

                    • false (64 bit architecture)
